name: AK-74
description: Soviet assault rifle chambered in 5.45x39mm. Reliable and widely used standard infantry weapon.

spots.description: Weapons crate in the main factory floor

notes: The standard AK-74 offers excellent reliability and manageable recoil for 5.45x39mm ammunition. Features traditional wooden furniture and iron sights.
tips: Great starter rifle with good damage output and moderate recoil. Suitable for medium-range engagements.

name: AK-74M
description: Modernized version of the AK-74 with improved ergonomics and rail system for attachments.
notes: Modernized AK-74 with folding polymer stock and side-mounted rail for optics. Improved ergonomics over the standard model.
tips: Better handling and attachment options than standard AK-74. Slightly heavier but more versatile.

name: AK-74N (Factory)
description: Factory variant of the AK-74N with side-mounted rail system for optics attachment.
notes: Factory configuration with standard furniture and side rail mount. Reliable platform for scope mounting.
tips: Excellent base for customization with optics. Maintains classic AK reliability with modern scope compatibility.

name: AK-74N MOD1
description: Modified AK-74N with enhanced furniture and improved ergonomics for tactical operations.
notes: Tactical modification with lightweight furniture and enhanced ergonomics. Significantly improved handling characteristics.
tips: Premium variant with excellent ergonomics and reduced weight. Perfect for fast-paced tactical operations.

name: AKS-74U
description: Compact carbine version of the AK-74. Higher mobility, shorter range. Perfect for close-quarters combat.
notes: Shortened barrel AK-74 variant designed for paratroopers and vehicle crews. Folding stock provides compact storage.
tips: Excellent mobility and handling for CQB. Reduced barrel length affects accuracy at longer ranges.

name: AKS-74U ZT
description: Tactical variant of the AKS-74U with enhanced ergonomics and improved recoil control systems.
notes: Zero-Tolerance tactical configuration with improved ergonomics and refined recoil characteristics. Enhanced for special operations use.
tips: Superior handling and recoil control compared to standard AKS-74U. Faster ADS speed makes it ideal for aggressive playstyles.

name: AKM
description: Modernized AK-47 chambered in 7.62x39mm. Higher damage, more recoil than 5.45mm variants.
notes: Classic 7.62x39mm assault rifle with proven reliability. Heavier hitting than 5.45mm variants but with increased recoil.
tips: Excellent stopping power for medium range engagements. Higher recoil requires better recoil management than AK-74 series.

name: AKMN
description: AKM variant with side-mounted rail system for optics attachment. Standard configuration with wooden furniture.
notes: Standard AKMN with traditional wooden furniture and side rail mount. Reliable platform for optics mounting.
tips: Classic AKM with scope mounting capability. Maintains traditional aesthetics while allowing modern optics.

name: AKMN-G
description: Romanian AKMN variant with enhanced furniture and slightly improved recoil characteristics.
notes: Enhanced AKMN variant with improved furniture and slightly better recoil management through design refinements.
tips: Marginally better handling than standard AKMN. Good balance of classic reliability with minor performance improvements.

name: AKMN-GLP
description: omanian AKMN version but Lacking parts.
notes: Dong-style foregrip. Reduced weight comes at the cost of necessary parts.
tips: Significantly lighter than standard AKM variants but harder to control. The weight reduction aids mobility but increases felt recoil.

name: AKMN-XM
description: Tactical AKMN variant with modern furniture and significantly improved recoil control systems.
notes: Premium tactical configuration with modern furniture and advanced recoil mitigation systems. Significantly improved controllability.
tips: Top-tier AKM variant with excellent recoil control. Higher price is justified by superior handling characteristics and tactical features.

name: AR-15 Pistol
description: Compact AR-15 platform pistol with short barrel and stabilizing brace. High mobility for close quarters, but single fire only.
notes: Compact AR platform with pistol classification. Short barrel reduces velocity but maximizes maneuverability in tight spaces.
tips: Excellent for CQB with fast handling. Higher MOA means reduced accuracy at range compared to rifle-length AR platforms.

name: M4A1 Agent
description: Lightweight tactical M4A1 configuration optimized for special operations with enhanced mobility.
notes: Special operations variant with lightweight construction and enhanced ergonomics. Optimized for rapid deployment scenarios.
tips: Premium handling characteristics with excellent ergonomics. Higher fire rate makes it effective for aggressive tactics.

name: M4A1 CQBR
description: Close Quarters Battle Receiver variant with optimized barrel length and tactical accessories for urban combat.
notes: Purpose-built for close quarters battle with optimized barrel length and tactical rail systems. Heavier due to additional accessories.
tips: Better accuracy than shorter variants while maintaining good CQB performance. Weight penalty from accessories affects mobility.

name: M4A1 DD
description: Daniel Defense M4A1 variant with premium barrel and enhanced accuracy for precision applications.
notes: Premium Daniel Defense configuration with exceptional recoil control and accuracy. High-end components throughout.
tips: Superior recoil control makes this ideal for sustained fire. Excellent balance of accuracy and controllability.

name: M4A1 Factory
description: Standard factory configuration M4A1 with military specifications and proven reliability.
notes: Standard military configuration with proven reliability and consistent performance. Base platform for customization.
tips: Reliable baseline M4A1 with good all-around performance. Moderate ergonomics but excellent upgrade potential.

name: AR15 Hunter Hunter
description: Precision-oriented AR15 variant with enhanced accuracy features and optimized for longer range engagements. Single fire.
notes: Precision configuration with heavier barrel and enhanced accuracy features. Optimized for designated marksman roles.
tips: Lower fire rate and heavier weight improve accuracy but reduce mobility. Best suited for medium to long range engagements.

name: HK416
description: German-designed rifle based on AR-15 platform. Best rate of fire in the class.
notes: Premium AR-platform rifle with piston-driven gas system for enhanced reliability. Excellent build quality and accuracy.
tips: Superior recoil control and reliability compared to direct impingement AR rifles. Higher fire rate makes it effective for rapid engagements.

name: M16A2
description: Classic full-length M16 rifle with 20-inch barrel. Excellent accuracy and range for designated marksman use.
notes: Full-length military rifle with 20-inch barrel providing excellent ballistic performance. Classic fixed stock configuration.
tips: Outstanding accuracy with low MOA makes this ideal for medium to long range engagements. Lower ergonomics due to fixed stock design.

name: M16A2 LV2
description: Enhanced M16A2 variant with improved furniture and slightly better handling characteristics.
notes: Improved M16A2 with enhanced furniture and ergonomics. Lighter weight and better handling while maintaining accuracy.
tips: Better balanced than standard M16A2 with improved ergonomics and reduced weight. Maintains excellent accuracy characteristics.

name: Glock 18C
description: Austrian pistol with full-auto capability. High rate of fire with compensated barrel for recoil control.
notes: Select-fire pistol with compensated barrel ports. Extremely high rate of fire makes it effective for close-range suppression.
tips: Very fast handling but challenging recoil control. High MOA means it's only effective at close range. Burst fire recommended.

name: M1911
description: Classic American pistol chambered in .45 ACP. High damage per shot with traditional single-action design.
notes: Legendary .45 ACP pistol with over a century of service. Single-stack magazine limits capacity but provides manageable grip.
tips: Higher penetration than 9mm pistols but limited magazine capacity. Excellent for backup weapon or stealth operations.

name: M92 (Beretta)
description: Italian 9mm service pistol with high capacity and reliable double-action mechanism.
notes: Standard NATO service pistol with 15-round capacity. Open-slide design and reliable feeding mechanism.
tips: Best accuracy among 9mm pistols with excellent ergonomics. High capacity magazine makes it ideal for extended engagements.

name: P250
description: Compact striker-fired pistol with consistent trigger pull and modular design.
notes: Modern striker-fired design with modular frame system. Consistent trigger pull and reliable feeding.
tips: Slightly lower fire rate than other pistols but good overall balance. Affordable option with decent performance characteristics.

name: AUG A1
description: Austrian bullpup assault rifle with integrated optic. Compact design with full-length barrel performance.
notes: Classic bullpup design with integrated 1.5x optic. Balanced weight distribution and compact profile for urban operations.
tips: Excellent accuracy with built-in optic. Bullpup design provides full barrel length in compact package but limits customization.

name: AUG A3 CQB
description: Close quarters variant with shortened barrel and enhanced maneuverability for urban combat operations.
notes: CQB-optimized variant with shorter barrel and rail system. Enhanced ergonomics for close quarters engagements.
tips: Improved handling and ergonomics over A1. Shorter barrel reduces accuracy but increases maneuverability in tight spaces.

name: AUG A3 RIS
description: Rail Interface System variant with full-length Picatinny rails for extensive customization options.
notes: Modernized AUG with full rail interface system. Excellent platform for optics and accessories while maintaining bullpup advantages.
tips: Best recoil control in AUG family with extensive customization options. Ideal for users who want modern attachments on bullpup platform.

name: AUG A3 STG77
description: Austrian military standard variant with traditional furniture and proven reliability in military service.
notes: Standard Austrian military configuration with traditional furniture and integrated optic. Proven battlefield reliability.
tips: Similar to A1 but with military-grade components. Excellent accuracy and reliability, ideal for general-purpose use.

name: AUG Para
description: Paratrooper variant with 9mm conversion and optimized for close quarters and suppressed operations.
notes: Unique 9mm conversion of the AUG platform. Excellent for suppressed operations and reduced penetration scenarios.
tips: Outstanding recoil control and ergonomics. Lower penetration but excellent for situations requiring reduced overpenetration risk.

name: SECA-17 SSR
description: Sniper Support Rifle variant with extended barrel and precision features for designated marksman role.
notes: Precision-oriented SCAR variant with extended barrel and enhanced accuracy features. Optimized for designated marksman role.
tips: Excellent accuracy and penetration for long-range engagements. Slower ADS and heavier weight limit mobility but provide superior ballistic performance.

name: SECA-17 Black
description: Standard SCAR-H battle rifle in black finish. Balanced performance for general-purpose combat operations.
notes: Standard SCAR-H configuration with proven reliability and modularity. Excellent balance of power and handling.
tips: Good all-around battle rifle with high penetration. Better mobility than SSR variant while maintaining excellent stopping power.

name: SECA-17 FDE
description: Flat Dark Earth variant of the SCAR-H with identical performance to black model but desert-optimized finish.
notes: FDE finish variant optimized for desert and arid environments. Identical performance to black variant with different aesthetics.
tips: Same excellent performance as black SCAR-17 with slightly higher shift momentum. Choice between variants is primarily aesthetic.

name: SECA-16 FDE
description: FN-SCAR-L
notes: 5.56x45mm SCAR

name: Mossberg 590
description: American pump-action shotgun chambered in 12 gauge. Devastating at close range with reliable pump action.
notes: Military and law enforcement pump-action shotgun. Single-shot manual cycling but devastating stopping power at close range.
tips: Extremely high damage per shot but slow rate of fire. Effective range limited but unmatched close-quarters lethality.

name: Winchester M1897
description: Historic pump-action shotgun with external hammer. Proven design from early 20th century.
notes: Classic pump-action design with external hammer. Historical significance and proven reliability in combat.
tips: Higher recoil than modern shotguns but excellent stopping power. External hammer design requires careful handling.

name: Sjögren Inertia
description: Early automatic shotgun with inertia-operated action. Innovative design from early 1900s.
notes: Historic automatic shotgun with inertia operation. Early innovation in self-loading shotgun technology.
tips: Automatic fire provides faster follow-up shots than pump-action. Historical rarity but excellent performance characteristics.

name: Flame-12
description: Automatic shotgun with high rate of fire. Devastating suppressive fire capability at close range.
notes: Fully automatic shotgun with devastating close-range firepower. Unique among shotguns for sustained automatic fire capability.
tips: Exceptional close-range area denial weapon. High recoil but unmatched sustained firepower for room clearing operations.

name: Mosin Nagant
description: Russian bolt-action rifle chambered in 7.62x54mmR. High damage, slow rate of fire. Classic sniper platform.
notes: Legendary Russian rifle with over a century of service. Excellent accuracy and stopping power with traditional bolt-action reliability.
tips: Outstanding accuracy and penetration for the price. Poor ergonomics but unmatched long-range performance per dollar.

name: Mosin 91/30
description: Updated Mosin variant with improved sights and slightly enhanced accuracy characteristics.
notes: Refined Mosin variant with improved sights and slightly better accuracy. Lighter weight improves handling characteristics.
tips: Can use scope

name: Mosin M38
description: Carbine variant of the Mosin with shortened barrel for improved maneuverability.
notes: Shortened carbine variant with improved mobility. Reduced barrel length affects accuracy but enhances maneuverability.
tips: Best ergonomics in Mosin family with significantly improved handling. Accuracy penalty but much more practical for mobile operations.

name: Mosin Obrez
description: Drastically shortened Mosin variant. Extreme modification sacrifices accuracy for concealability.
notes: Extreme modification with drastically shortened barrel and stock. Concealable but with severe accuracy penalties.
tips: Excellent ergonomics and lightest weight but poor accuracy. Unique niche as concealable high-power weapon.

name: M40A5
description: Modern military sniper rifle with precision barrel and advanced accuracy features for long-range precision shooting.
notes: State-of-the-art military sniper rifle with exceptional accuracy. Premium components throughout for maximum precision.
tips: Best-in-class accuracy with outstanding MOA. Highest penetration among sniper rifles makes it effective against all targets.

name: SKS
description: Soviet semi-automatic carbine chambered in 7.62x39mm. Reliable gas-operated action with integrated bayonet.
notes: Classic Soviet carbine bridging bolt-action and assault rifle eras. Gas-operated semi-automatic with traditional wooden stock.
tips: Excellent medium-range performance with good accuracy. Higher recoil than modern rifles but reliable stopping power.

name: SVT-40
description: Soviet semi-automatic rifle chambered in 7.62x54mmR. Advanced design for its era with excellent range capabilities.
notes: Advanced WWII-era semi-automatic rifle. Innovative gas system and excellent accuracy for its time period.
tips: Better accuracy and ergonomics than SKS with more powerful cartridge. Higher recoil but excellent long-range performance.

name: PKP Pecheneg
description: Russian general-purpose machine gun chambered in 7.62x54mmR. Devastating sustained firepower with air-cooled barrel.
notes: Heavy machine gun designed for sustained fire support. Air-cooled barrel allows continuous operation without overheating concerns.
tips: Devastating firepower but requires setup time. Extremely slow ADS makes it unsuitable for mobile combat. Excellent for defensive positions and suppressive fire.

name: MP5A3
description: German submachine gun chambered in 9x19mm. Excellent for close quarters with proven reliability.
notes: Legendary 9mm SMG with roller-delayed blowback action. Standard for police and military CQB operations worldwide.
tips: Excellent recoil control and ergonomics for rapid fire. Limited range but outstanding in close quarters engagements.

name: CZ Scorpion EVO3
description: Czech submachine gun with modern polymer construction and high rate of fire for aggressive tactics.
notes: Modern polymer SMG with excellent ergonomics and high fire rate. Popular choice for tactical teams and special operations.
tips: Higher fire rate than MP5 with modern features. Better accuracy and lighter weight make it excellent for mobile operations.

name: UMP45
description: German submachine gun chambered in .45 ACP. Higher stopping power with manageable recoil.
notes: Lightweight SMG using .45 ACP for enhanced stopping power. Polymer construction keeps weight down despite larger cartridge.
tips: Higher penetration than 9mm SMGs with good accuracy. Slower fire rate aids control but reduces suppressive capability.

name: MP9
description: Compact Swiss submachine gun with extremely high rate of fire. Designed for close protection and special operations.
notes: Ultra-compact SMG with exceptional mobility. Highest fire rate in class makes it devastating at point-blank range.
tips: Lightest SMG with excellent handling. Very high fire rate requires careful ammunition management but provides overwhelming firepower.

name: MP9-N
description: Enhanced MP9 variant with improved recoil control systems and refined ergonomics.
notes: Improved MP9 with enhanced recoil control and ergonomics. Better handling characteristics while maintaining compact size.
tips: Superior ergonomics and recoil control over standard MP9. Reduced recoil momentum makes it more controllable in sustained fire.

name: MP9-T
description: Tactical variant of the MP9 with further enhanced recoil control and optimized for suppressed operations.
notes: Top-tier MP9 variant with maximum recoil control and ergonomics. Optimized for tactical operations and suppressed use.
tips: Best recoil control in MP9 family with outstanding ergonomics. Premium performance justifies higher cost for specialized operations.

name: M3A1 Grease Gun
description: American WWII-era submachine gun with simple blowback action. Reliable but slow-firing design.
notes: Historical WWII submachine gun with simple, reliable construction. Slow fire rate but proven battlefield reliability.
tips: Lower fire rate aids control but reduces firepower. Heavier than modern SMGs but very reliable and affordable.

name: Thompson M1928
description: Iconic American submachine gun from prohibition era. High-quality construction with distinctive appearance.
notes: Legendary 'Tommy Gun' , unfortunately without distinctive drum magazine capability.
tips: Heaviest SMG but good firepower. Poor ergonomics offset by historical significance and solid performance.

name: BX4
description: Compact personal defense weapon with high mobility and rapid fire capability for close protection roles.
notes: Compact PDW designed for close protection and vehicle crews. Excellent mobility with better accuracy than traditional SMGs.
tips: Bridge between SMGs and rifles with better range capability. Lower MOA than most SMGs makes it effective at medium range.

name: Malyuk 5.45
description: Ukrainian bullpup assault rifle chambered in 5.45x39mm. Compact design with full-length barrel performance.
notes: Modern Ukrainian bullpup rifle based on AK action. Combines traditional reliability with compact bullpup advantages.
tips: Excellent ergonomics for a bullpup design. Good accuracy and recoil control while maintaining compact profile.

name: Malyuk 7.62
description: Ukrainian bullpup assault rifle chambered in 7.62x39mm. Higher stopping power in compact bullpup configuration.
notes: 7.62x39mm variant offering higher stopping power. Same excellent ergonomics with increased recoil from larger cartridge.
tips: Higher penetration than 5.45mm variant but with increased recoil. Choose based on engagement range and armor penetration needs.

name: AR-308
description: Large-frame AR platform chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO. Combines AR ergonomics with battle rifle power.
notes: Large-frame AR-10 style rifle with excellent accuracy and stopping power. Modern ergonomics with battle rifle capabilities.
tips: Outstanding accuracy and penetration for long-range engagements. Heavier than 5.56mm ARs but superior ballistic performance.

name: AR-308 LT
description: Lightweight variant of the AR-308 with reduced weight and enhanced ergonomics for improved mobility.
notes: Lightweight variant with premium materials and enhanced ergonomics. Improved handling while maintaining full power.
tips: Significantly better ergonomics and lighter weight make this more practical for mobile operations. Premium price reflects advanced construction.

name: FN FAL
description: Belgian battle rifle chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO. Legendary 'Right Arm of the Free World' with proven combat record.
notes: Legendary battle rifle adopted by over 90 countries. Gas-operated action with adjustable gas regulator for reliability.
tips: High penetration with excellent accuracy. Poor ergonomics typical of 1950s design but proven battlefield effectiveness.

name: XM5
description: Next-generation US military rifle with advanced recoil control systems and modern ballistics performance.
notes: Next-generation rifle with 6.8x51mm cartridge and advanced recoil mitigation. Represents the future of infantry weapons.
tips: Excellent recoil control for the power level. New cartridge offers good penetration with manageable recoil through advanced design.

name: G3A3
description: German battle rifle chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO. Reliable delayed blowback operation with excellent range capabilities.
notes: Classic German battle rifle with delayed blowback system. Heavy but reliable for long-range engagements.
tips: Excellent for medium to long range combat. The heavy weight helps with recoil control but affects mobility.

name: HK51
description: Compact carbine variant of the G3 rifle with shortened barrel for close-quarters operations.
notes: Shortened G3 variant designed for close-quarters combat. Higher mobility but reduced accuracy at range.
tips: Better ergonomics than the full-size G3 but with increased muzzle blast and reduced long-range effectiveness.

name: HK51K
description: Ultra-compact version of the HK51 with further reduced barrel length for maximum maneuverability.
notes: Most compact G3 variant with exceptional mobility but significant muzzle flash and blast.
tips: Excellent for CQB operations. The light weight allows for quick handling but expect heavy recoil and flash.

name: HK51 ACE
description: Modified HK51 with aftermarket enhancements and improved ergonomics for professional use.
notes: Enhanced HK51 variant with improved recoil control and tactical accessories. Premium build quality.
tips: Better recoil management than standard HK51 variants. Ideal for operators who need compact power with control.

name: HK91 Wood
description: Civilian semi-automatic version of the G3 rifle featuring traditional wooden furniture and classic styling.
notes: Classic wooden-stocked variant with traditional aesthetics. Heavier than modern polymer versions but well-balanced.
tips: The wooden stock provides good stability for precision shooting but adds weight. Great for long-range work.

name: PSG-1
description: Precision sniper rifle based on the G3 platform with match-grade barrel and specialized trigger system.
notes: Elite precision sniper rifle with exceptional accuracy. Heavy and slow to handle but unmatched for long-range precision.
tips: Ultimate precision weapon for long-range engagements. The weight and slow handling make it unsuitable for mobile combat.

name: G3SG1 AK4
description: Swedish military variant of the G3SG1 sniper rifle with enhanced optics mounting system and improved barrel.
notes: Swedish military designation for the G3SG1 sniper rifle. Features improved optics integration and reliability.
tips: Well-balanced sniper variant with good ergonomics. Lighter than the PSG-1 while maintaining precision capabilities.

name: G3SG1 PRS
description: Precision Rifle System variant of the G3SG1 with modern tactical stock and enhanced accuracy features.
notes: Modern precision rifle system with adjustable stock and improved recoil management. Optimized for tactical operations.
tips: Excellent balance of precision and handling. The PRS stock system allows for better shooter adaptation and comfort.

name: G3SG1 Spuhr
description: G3SG1 equipped with premium Spuhr mounting system for enhanced optics stability and precision shooting.
notes: Features premium Spuhr optics mounting system for maximum stability and repeatability. Professional-grade precision rifle.
tips: Top-tier precision variant with excellent optics mounting. The Spuhr system ensures scope zero retention under heavy use.
